programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of UFOs during the Black Death, and examine the theory that aliens may have inflicted the disease on the human race.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick searches for a pair of 1920s petrol pumps, but a 1930s horse-gambling wheel catches his eye.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team returns a 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox to its former glory, while Rick makes a deal to buy a 1940s vending machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick salvages a film projector that is more than 100 years old and two 1950s petrol-station showpieces.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick offers to repair a vintage mechanical bull, and also restores a 1940s soft drinks machine.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a gamble by buying an elephant's head from a taxidermist, and the guys are tempted to purchase an antique hot dog steamer.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of three new crews - S and S Aqua Logging, Rygaard Logging and R and R Conner Aviation, which uses helicopters to shift felled trees.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The logging season begins, with the stakes as well as the temperature rising, as the lumberjacks brave alligator-infested swamps.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick takes on the challenge of restoring a weighing machine from the 1900s, while the team also tackles a 1930s baby walker.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick works his magic on a vintage Italian bumper car from an antiques shop, while the team repairs a 1970s toy tractor.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with BBC Breakfast presenter Naga Munchetty and comedian Josh Widdicombe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: That's What Debt Actually Is, Actually
programme.desc: The comedian discusses a convoluted way of getting rid of an unwanted gift, reimagines a classic game show, and reveals how the diamond industry could be brought to its knees.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Unable to convince Lucy that he did not smash a blue and white antique vase that belonged to her grandmother, Lee summons the family to a meeting to flush out the culprit.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy takes the kids away to her parents while Lee stays in the house to oversee the building work being done their kitchen, but unfortunately the tradesman he has employed has an annoyingly relaxed attitude to deadlines. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Rhys James and Ellie Taylor join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, the comedian crosses 1,000 miles of South Africa, reaching the most southerly passenger railway station on the continent. Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. Later on, he takes to the skies in a light aircraft for a bird's-eye view of one of South Africa's largest ostrich farms, and catches one of the world's most luxurious trains for a seven-hour ride to Cape Town, before reaching the coastal settlement of Simon's Town.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a DJ leads Nikki to question her judgement in a strikingly similar case from her past and she brings the potential mistake to the attention of her colleagues, but the news threatens to have repercussions for the family of the deceased, the police and the Lyell Centre. The fresh evidence leads to the conclusion that a copycat killer is at large and Nikki finds evidence that an intruder has been entering her home. Feature-length episode of the drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh struggles to prove his innocence and win back Penny after failing a drug test. Meryl and Charlie lock horns over Hayley's entry in the Miss Whyhope competition.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky Midnight News
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Real Chernobyl
programme.desc: Sky News documentary special meeting people in Ukraine who were involved in the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: A Week in Interviews
programme.desc: Highlights of some of the best interviews on Sky News over the last seven days.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
programme.desc: Veteran war zone journalists Stuart Ramsay and Alex Crawford illustrate the dangers, complexities and emotions of reporting from troubled spots around the world.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Basic Instinct (1992)
programme.desc: A hard-drinking San Francisco cop investigates the case of a man murdered with an ice-pick, but his normally well-honed intuition starts letting him down as he falls for the sultry and manipulative chief suspect, the victim's former girlfriend. Thriller from director Paul Verhoeven, starring Sharon Stone, Michael Douglas, George Dzundza and Jeanne Tripplehorn.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Actress, comedian and writer Helen Lederer throws today's dinner party, and Brian McFadden provides another four diners with cryptic clues hinting at the identity of their mystery hostess.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The This Morning presenter returns to put more Christmas gifts to the test, aided by his wife Steph, celebrity guests and members of the public. They begin by gearing up for Black Friday with tips on the best gifts and gadgets on the market. With sales of personal electric vehicles on the up, Corrie trio Jack P Shepherd (David), Alan Halsall (Tyrone) and Colson Smith (Craig) put hoverboards and scooters to the test. Clare Balding is on a mission to find the perfect present for pets and Eddie 'the Eagle' Edwards ranks gift experiences such as track racing, skydiving and flyboarding.

programme.title: The Ultimate Christmas Party
programme.desc: We've got that Christmas feeling and those party vibes! Here are some of the ultimate party tracks to kick off your Christmas party.

programme.title: That Christmas Feeling
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: Takin' It Old Skool
programme.desc: We're takin' you back to the old skool with some of the best tracks from the last few decades.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: UK Music Video Chart Of The Year: Top 40
programme.desc: We've teamed up with YouTube to compile a chart of the most watched videos of the year.

programme.title: Super Hits & New Releases!
programme.desc: Tune in to these super-hot hits and the latest trending videos. Look no further for today's music fix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Investigating a UFO crash that was believed to be a Soviet satellite. Plus, a probe sent to Mars discovers evidence of frozen water on the red planet.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Peruvian Alien Skull and Baltic Sea UFO
programme.desc: A tiny skeleton defies medical explanation in Peru, and this programme investigates if it is a missing link in human evolution or proof of extra-terrestrial contact.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The comedian, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and team captains Kerry Godliman and Andy Parsons, oversees a battle between The Beehive from Somerset and the Wheelwright Arms from Chester.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Footage of heart-pounding getaways, including cabs running wild on the streets, and unfortunate and dramatic miscalculations of load height.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of what happens when animals challenge vehicles over right-of-way on the road. Plus, dangerous drag races.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of train crash explosions, storm chasers who narrowly escape death, a window platform smashing into a building, cars and trucks colliding and a helicopter accident.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of firefighters caught up in an explosion, missile warheads exploding in a tunnel, an avalanche burying a city, and a racing car snapping in two at 310mph.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy calls in his team to snag a Czechoslovakian fighter jet, and Ken Cage and Danny Thompson end up under fire after going after a $2million Citation CJ1.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A man asks the team to carry out a makeover on a friend's truck to pay him back for the kidney he donated.

programme.title: The Lost Women of NXIVM
programme.desc: An in-depth investigation into the four women members of Keith Raniere's NXIVM cult, whose members either vanished or died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 26-year-old pregnant student Loretta Saunders. Her body was found 12 days after she went missing in February 2014, dumped off a Canadian highway, hundreds of miles from her home. Heavy snow had prevented it from being discovered earlier.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Carla Fuqua, who vanished after a night out with friends in October 2009. A dedicated mother, it was known that the 28-year-old would never leave her son behind. More alarmingly, Carla became the fourth missing person in a town of less than 5,000. Her remains were found three years later in a wooded area in Alabama, but eventually her kiiller was caught.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Officers reveal a sophisticated burglary with estimated losses of £8million when they investigate why a bank manager is unable to open his vault.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: As summer arrives, temperatures soar to more than 100 degrees. Mark rescues a skinny Rottweiler chained out in the sun and investigators seek out kittens trapped under roof tiles.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A West Highland Terrier called Chester dislikes skateboarders. Concerned that he will bite someone, his owners take him to see Chris to see if he can help tame him.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A dream dress turns into a nightmare, and a customer finally finds her perfect gown - only to realise it costs double her budget.
